titleStmt.title: URFA-027
SHAWI Corpus
titleStmt.funder: Funded by the FWF Austrian Science Fund under the number P 33574

publicationStmt.distributor: Austrian Center for Digital Humanities and Cultural Heritage

prefixDef.p: Private URIs using the teiCorpusHeader prefix are pointers to any element in the SHAWI teiCorpus document.
Private URIs using the share prefix are pointers to audio file residing on the SHAWI network share.
Private URIs using the geo prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a place element in VICAV Geodata list.
Private URIs using the zotid prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a biblStruct element in the TEI export of the VICAV Zotero Group library.

spanGrp.span: In former times, it was done by using draught animals: horses and cows. Nowadays it is done by tractors.

In the past they cultivated the fields with draught animals: horses, oxen, we call them fiddān (draught animal). The ox, we call it ṯōr, it cultivated the field as a draught animal; and the mule. They sowed the wheat with their hands

Now the tractor has come, there is the sowing machine; they fill the sowing machine and cultivate the field with the tractor. Such the wheat grows and then the harvester comes and harvests it. Our income has become like this now.
In the past there was no water here in Urfa, the water arrived here thirty forty years ago, thank God there’s a lot, thank God.
Before the dam they cultivated wheat and barley (relying) on rain.
Relying on the rain, like you; wheat and barley, we used to cultivate wheat and barley. If there was rain, it grew, if there was no rain, it didn’t grow.
If there was a lot of rain, the wheat would grow like that. If there was no rain the wheat died like that, it died. Again by God’s willing
The humanbeing has become a devil, he knows where the wells are and now there is water beneath us here.
Do you have animals? ˗˗ Yes, there is sheep, cows, goats, horses, workhorses, so it is. Even the workhorses are gone and the cows have become few.

Syria was isolated in former times, they were basically enemies; they were enemies. After the (Assad) government had come into power, the families stayed in their respective lands (they could not visit each other) and started to work and it was like that.
In former times, the land belonged to the Bedouins, they used to come and then they left again and settled until they left again carrying (their things with them).
That was in the time of the Banu Hilāl. It is said that they moved and settled with camels. Nowadays there are no camels anymore.
Nowadays there are many tractors, cars, and trucks. Everything has become abundant, thank God.
Syria and Turkey used to be; in former times, ten, fifteen years ago, before Apo was arrested,
they used to be enemies. Syria supplied terrorism and sent it to Turkey. It supplied (terror) and sent it to Turkey, sent it to Turkey.
They sent them and their weapons and so in order to destroy Turkey. They wanted to destroy Turkey.
They had Apo there (in Syria), Abdullah Öcalan. They were supporting (him) there. After Turkey had become angry with them, they said:
“What is he looking for with you? You either bring and hand him over to us or we will wage war on you and hit you.”
So they kicked him out. He went to… where did he go? To Kenya, to Africa.
When they caught him. Where was he when they caught him? ˗˗ He had fled the country. – He had run away, where was he when they caught him? In Kenya?
It was Kenya, wasn’t it? He went to Africa. And in Syria Ḥāfiḏ̣ Asad died.
When Ḥāfiḏ̣ Asad died, his son came to power. He realized that he had no solution but to make a deal with Turkey.
Things have become good between him (Syria) and Turkey. Though they were enemies at first.
